Job Posting:174666 - Position: W26 Junior Data Analyst Co-op 174666 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/27/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 10/22/2025 08:46 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Trulioo Information Services Inc. #1200 1055 W Hastings Vancouver V6E 2E9 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Junior Data Analyst Co-op 174666 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 8 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 40 Major List $22 - $25/hour Work Arrangements: Start & End Date of Work Term: Jan 13, 2026 - August 21, 2026 • • Duration: 8 months • Hourly Pay Rate: $22/hour for Bachelor's degree, and $25/hour for Master's degree students plus 4% vacation pay • Full-time: 40 hour work week • Perks: 4 days paid sick day allowance, office lunches, happy hours and other social events! • Hybrid Model: Working at least 3 days per week from our Mount Pleasant office, located at 114 E 4th Ave #400, Vancouver, BC V5T 1G2 All interviews will be conducted virtually via Zoom video call. Are you ready to embark on a career that truly affects people around the world? Trulioo invites you to be a catalyst for change in the dynamic realm of digital identity verification. As the global front-runner in our industry, we are redefining how businesses grow, innovate and comply online. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, contributing to our award-winning platform that enables organizations worldwide to quickly onboard customers, optimize costs and combat fraud. Fueled by Silicon Valley support, Trulioo stands as the trusted platform that can verify more than 5 billion people and 700 million business entities spanning 195 countries. But Trulioo is more than a tech company. We are a united force of dedicated experts committed to establishing trust online. Headquartered in Vancouver and with strategic hubs in San Diego and Dublin, we foster a culture of collaboration and open communication. Our offices support a hybrid model and staff typically work three days per week at a hub location. Join us where excitement meets innovation and contribute to a world where trust and technology unite. Position Summary: To help continue to fuel our growth, we are looking for a team-oriented, business-savvy, and passionate Junior Data Analyst Co- op to expand our Data Science team. As a Junior Data Analyst Co-op, you will report to the Manager of Data Analytics and will be responsible for assisting in running our batch processes. This includes data cleansing, processing, analysis, and visualization, as well as deriving outcome-based recommendations and creating presentations of findings. This is an 8-month, fixed-term position based out of our Mount Pleasant office in Vancouver, following a hybrid work model with three in-office days per week. What you'll be doing: • Assisting the Manager of Data Analytics in running the proof-of-value processes. • Directly supporting Trulioo in their Enterprise and Midmarket business acquisition and expansion. • Helping to demonstrate our leading Person Match (KYC), Watchlist Screening, and Business Verify (KYB) solutions on offer. • Reviewing customer data files for quality and consistency. • • Performing batch processing for trial and production accounts using internal tools. Analyzing results data to identify trends, exceptions, and areas for further investigation. • Using data analysis skills to translate complex information in a clear, meaningful, and structured way. • Visualizing findings in a variety of charts, presentations, and/or written reports. • Applying critical thinking to assess and determine options, and subsequently making outcome-based recommendations. • Leveraging Python skills to improve upon existing process automation scripts and potentially develop new scripts where required. • Identifying opportunities to improve processes and collaborate on implementing changes. • Communicating effectively, both orally and in writing, including the potential presentation of findings to clients. • Collaborating with the wider Data Science team and assisting them in their reporting and analytics challenges in SQL and Tableau. Thriving at Trulioo At Trulioo, you're not just an employee. You're a valued member of our Trulicrew on a journey of professional and personal growth with a world-class organization. With Trulioo, you have the power to revolutionize the intersection of technology, digital trust and online identity to open the global economy to everyone. Together, we can shape the digital future. We're on the lookout for exceptional people to empower with trust, autonomy and the freedom to cultivate their potential. Your curiosity, meticulous attention to detail and passion to contribute are highly valued. If that resonates with you, apply today to become a part of our team. Join us in shaping a future where your career isn't just a journey but also a boundless exploration into the possibilities of technology and digital identity verification. If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that minorities and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply. Trulioo welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Support is available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Finally, we know from time-to-time emergencies happen and you may need to reschedule an interview - we understand and encourage you to be in communication without worrying about losing the opportunity or your credibility. Privacy Notice As part of our job application process, Trulioo collects, processes, and discloses personal data for the purpose of identifying suitable candidates for our job openings. For more detail, please visit Trulioo's Website Privacy Policy in the section "When you apply for a job". Job Requirements Important Requirements: You must be pursuing a Diploma, Undergraduate or Graduate degree. • • You must be enrolled at an accredited university in British Columbia. • Participation in your university's co-op program is a must. • Must include an unofficial transcript with your resume. • Complete all necessary requirements set forth by your educational institution, including application processes and associated fees. • For international students, possession of a valid Co-op work permit from Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) is mandatory. You have: • Completed the third year of a university degree program in Business Administration, Computer/Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or Statistics. • Have completed university courses or coursework using Python and SQL, or have completed external certifications. • The ability to adapt to new technologies and concepts quickly, and the confidence to follow and learn complex processes. • An analytical mind and a passion for problem-solving. • Experience in gathering, cleansing, analyzing, and reporting on data. • An understanding of the importance of protecting and correctly processing sensitive data. • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. • The ability to make sound decisions by following established guidelines while also demonstrating initiative when appropriate. Confidence in juggling multiple demands and competing priorities, ensuring deliverables are met consistently and on time. • It's a bonus if you have: • An interest in the prevention of financial crime, money laundering, fraud, and identity theft. • Previous experience in the tech or financial services industries. • Familiarity with Anaconda Suite, especially Jupyter and Spider. • Familiarity with PostgreSQL specifically. • Experience using MS Excel; able to perform pivot tables and pivot charts, use advanced formulae and Power Query. • Experience working with visualization tools such as Tableau, MS Power BI. • A desire to grow your personal and professional network outside of your course / university by engaging in the active social calendar of events; for Co-ops, with the department, and also companywide. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/coops&interns/jobs/5686431004 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
